title: Chancellor of Germany - Wikipedia
snippet: Ten people (nine men and one woman) have served as chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany, the first being Konrad Adenauer from 1949 to 1963. (Another 26 men had served as "Reich chancellors" of the previous German Empire from 1871 to 1945.) The current officeholder is Friedrich Merz ...

title: List of chancellors of Germany - Wikipedia
snippet: On 9 November 1918, Chancellor Max von Baden handed over his office to Friedrich Ebert. Ebert continued to serve as head of government during the three months between the end of the German Empire in November 1918 and the first gathering of the ...

title: List of chancellors of Germany by time in office - Wikipedia
snippet: Bismarck's successive tenure as Chancellor of the North German Confederation (1867–1871) and of the German Empire (1871–1890) is counted as one continuous term.

title: List of Chancellors of Germany (1871-2025)
snippet: One notable leader is Otto von Bismarck, who unified Germany in 1871 and served as its first chancellor. In the 20th century, Konrad Adenauer became the first chancellor of West Germany after World War II, leading from 1949 to 1963.
